com.stickycoding.Rokon
Class DynamicObject

java.lang.Object
  com.stickycoding.Rokon.DynamicObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
Emitter, Particle, Shape, Sprite
public class DynamicObject
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
Richard Handles all positions, rotations and movement Extended by Sprite, Emitter, Particle Created to bring together all dynamic methods for different types of object

setRotationPivotRelative

public void setRotationPivotRelative()
Defines rotation pivot coordinates as relative to the sprite. This does not change the actual pivot coordinates, but defines how the pivot coordinates are interpreted when rotating

setRotationPivotAbsolute

public void setRotationPivotAbsolute()
Defines rotation pivot coordinates as absolute/fixed (not relative to sprite). This does not change the actual pivot coordinates, but defines how the pivot coordinates are interpreted when rotating

getRotationPivotRelative

public boolean getRotationPivotRelative()
Returns:
TRUE if rotation pivot is relative, FALSE if absolute/fixed

resetDynamics

accelerate

public void accelerate(float accelerationX,
                       float accelerationY,
                       float terminalVelocityX,
                       float terminalVelocityY)
Accelerates a Sprite, note that this is relative to current Acceleration.

Parameters:
accelerationX - acceleration in X direction, pixels per second
accelerationY - acceleration in Y direction, pixels per second
terminalVelocityX - specifies a highest possible velocity in X direction, this will trigger reachedTerminalVelocityX
terminalVelocityY - specifies a highest possible velocity in Y direction, this will trigger reachedTerminalVelocityY

accelerate

public void accelerate(float accelerationX,
                       float accelerationY)
Accelerates a Sprite, note that this is relative to current Acceleration. Terminal velocity restrictions are removed.

Parameters:
accelerationX - acceleration in X direction, pixels per second
accelerationY - acceleration in Y direction, pixels per second

getAccelerationX

public float getAccelerationX()
Returns:
current acceleration in X direction, pixels per second

public float getAccelerationY()
Returns:
current acceleration in Y direction, pixels per second

setStopAtTerminalVelocity

public void setStopAtTerminalVelocity(boolean stopAtTerminalVelocity)
Parameters:
stopAtTerminalVelocity - TRUE if Sprite should stop at the terminal velocity, FALSE if it should continue accelerating

isStopAtTerminalVelocity

public boolean isStopAtTerminalVelocity()
Returns:
TRUE if the Sprite is going to stop when it reaches terminal velocity, FALSE if it will continue indefinately

setTerminalVelocity

public void setTerminalVelocity(float terminalVelocityX,
                                float terminalVelocityY)
Sets a terminal velocity at which the Sprite will stop accelerating, this will trigger reachedTerminalVelocityX and reachedTerminalVelocityY in your DynamicsHandler if set

Parameters:
terminalVelocityX -
terminalVelocityY -
